summary:
The code defines a `ClientSession` class in the `aiohttp` library, which provides an asynchronous HTTP client for making requests. It imports various modules and defines several constants and type aliases. The `ClientSession` class has a `close` method that closes the underlying connector and releases resources. The class also has various attributes such as `_base_url`, `_connector`, `_loop`, `_cookie_jar`, and others that store configuration and state information for the session. The code also defines a `DEFAULT_TIMEOUT` constant and a set of idempotent HTTP methods. The `ClientSession` class is used to create a session with a specific configuration and can be used to make HTTP requests.
The user wants a summary of the functionality of the code. They gave a snippet of code from aiohttp/client.py. The code includes imports, __all__, constants, and a close method. The user wants a summary focusing on business logic, inputs, outputs, in Chinese (or Chinese/English). They also want to start directly with the summary content, no "This code does..." or "Here is...".
